name: Foundation Setup
description:
Set up the foundational architecture for the code review app.

## Goal
Establish the core infrastructure: styling, state management, layout, testing, and git integration.

## Scope
- Frontend: Tailwind CSS with theming, Zustand, Radix UI, resizable panels, diff viewer
- Backend: git2 integration for reading repository data
- Testing: Vitest + React Testing Library
- Persistence: Tauri app data for repo list

## Out of Scope
- Actual features (commit browsing, diff viewing) - those come after foundation
- E2E testing - unit tests first

## Acceptance Criteria
- 3-panel layout renders with resizable dividers
- Light/dark/system theme switching works
- At least one Tauri command (list commits) callable from frontend
- Vitest runs with sample test passing
result:
Foundation setup complete. All 6 subtasks done:
- Frontend dependencies installed (zustand, tailwind, radix, vitest, etc.)
- Tailwind CSS with light/dark/system theming
- Vitest testing infrastructure with Tauri mocks
- 3-panel resizable layout shell
- git2 backend with list_commits command
- Zustand store for repo persistence

Ready for Phase 2: Core Features.

name: Add backend commands for commit files and diff
description:
Extend the git module with commands to get changed files and diffs.

## Commands to Add

### get_commit_files
```rust
#[derive(Serialize)]
struct ChangedFile {
    path: String,
    status: FileStatus, // Added, Modified, Deleted, Renamed
    additions: u32,
    deletions: u32,
    old_path: Option<String>, // For renames
}

#[tauri::command]
fn get_commit_files(repo_path: String, commit_id: String) -> Result<Vec<ChangedFile>, String>
```

### get_file_diff
```rust
#[derive(Serialize)]
struct DiffHunk {
    old_start: u32,
    old_lines: u32,
    new_start: u32,
    new_lines: u32,
    lines: Vec<DiffLine>,
}

#[derive(Serialize)]
struct DiffLine {
    content: String,
    line_type: LineType, // Context, Addition, Deletion
    old_line_no: Option<u32>,
    new_line_no: Option<u32>,
}

#[derive(Serialize)]
struct FileDiff {
    old_path: Option<String>,
    new_path: String,
    hunks: Vec<DiffHunk>,
    is_binary: bool,
}

#[tauri::command]
fn get_file_diff(repo_path: String, commit_id: String, file_path: String) -> Result<FileDiff, String>
```

### get_current_branch
```rust
#[tauri::command]
fn get_current_branch(repo_path: String) -> Result<String, String>
```

### validate_repo
```rust
#[derive(Serialize)]
struct RepoInfo {
    path: String,
    name: String, // Directory name
    branch: String,
}

#[tauri::command]
fn validate_repo(path: String) -> Result<RepoInfo, String>
```

## Files to Modify
- src-tauri/src/git.rs (add new functions)
- src-tauri/src/lib.rs (register commands)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All commands work correctly with test repos
- Proper error handling for edge cases (binary files, empty commits, etc.)
- Rust unit tests for new functions

name: Migrate Zustand persistence to Tauri fs plugin
description:
Replace localStorage with Tauri's app data directory for more robust cross-platform storage.

## Current State
Using Zustand persist middleware with localStorage ('code-review-storage' key).

## Why Migrate
- localStorage can be cleared by browser/webview cleanup
- Tauri app data directory is the proper location for desktop app data
- More consistent with native app behavior
- Survives webview cache clears

## Implementation
1. Add @tauri-apps/plugin-fs to frontend
2. Add tauri-plugin-fs to Cargo.toml
3. Register plugin and add capabilities
4. Create custom Zustand storage adapter using Tauri fs
5. Store in app data directory (e.g., ~/.local/share/code-review/store.json on Linux)
6. Handle migration from localStorage for existing users

## Files to Modify
- package.json (add @tauri-apps/plugin-fs)
- src-tauri/Cargo.toml (add tauri-plugin-fs)
- src-tauri/src/lib.rs (register plugin)
- src-tauri/capabilities/default.json (add fs permissions)
- src/store/appStore.ts (custom storage adapter)

## Acceptance Criteria
- Data persists in Tauri app data directory
- Existing localStorage data migrated on first run
- Works on macOS, Linux, Windows
- Unit tests updated
